poem:
Title: "On Words and Consequence"

In the theatre of law, truth's visage wanes,
Blanche's verbiage seeks to veil our pains.
"Cohen's a liar," he chants, a tenfold refrain,
Across the courtroom the echo remains.
Yet guilt's not measured in words alone,
Justice lives not in a juror's tone.
And even the charlatan under Merchan's gaze,
Is due his dawning - an unbiased day.
